title: IL-23–MMP Axis as a Driver of Rheumatoid Arthritis-Associated Bone Loss
text: We hypothesize that in rheumatoid arthritis, autoimmunity-induced dysregulation of the Th17 cell pathway elevates IL-23 levels, which in turn stimulate matrix metalloproteinase production. The resulting extracellular matrix degradation recruits fibroblast-like synoviocytes that amplify local pro-inflammatory cytokine expression, thereby activating osteoclast differentiation via the RANK/RANKL pathway and reducing bone mineral density. Targeting IL-23 or MMP activity may therefore complement RANKL inhibition (e.g., with Denosumab) to mitigate osteoporotic fractures.

mechanistic_summaries.path_summary: Autoimmunity is associated with a dysregulation in the Th17 cell pathway, leading to osteoporotic fractures characterized by a reduction in bone mineral density (BMD)

key_entities.definition: Autoimmunity is a condition in which the immune system mistakenly attacks the body's own tissues, leading to various autoimmune diseases. These can affect any part of the body and result in inflammation and damage.

Th17 cell pathway involves the differentiation of naive CD4(+) T cells into Th17 cells, crucial for immunologic responses, particularly in autoimmune diseases and inflammation. IL-6 is a key cytokine in this pathway, influencing many immune functions.

IL-23 is a pro-inflammatory cytokine that plays a crucial role in immune responses. It is involved in promoting T-helper 17 cell survival and induces various pro-inflammatory cytokines, facilitating bacterial clearance and immune system activation.

Matrix metalloproteinases (MMPs) are a group of enzymes that degrade extracellular matrix components, playing crucial roles in tissue remodeling, wound healing, and various pathological processes such as cancer metastasis and inflammation.

The extracellular matrix (ECM) consists of various proteins and molecules that provide structural and biochemical support to surrounding cells, playing vital roles in tissue and organ functions as well as in signaling pathways.

Fibroblast-like synoviocytes (FLS) are specialized cells in the synovial membrane involved in joint inflammation and remodeling. They play a key role in the pathogenesis of rheumatoid arthritis by contributing to the inflammatory response and tissue degradation.

Pro-inflammatory cytokines are signaling proteins that promote inflammation and play critical roles in immune responses, often associated with diseases and infection responses. They help recruit immune cells to sites of infection or injury and regulate various immune functions.

Osteoclast differentiation is a biological process involving the maturation of mononuclear precursor cells into osteoclasts, which are responsible for bone resorption, crucial for bone remodeling and homeostasis.

Bone tissue is a supportive tissue that provides structure, protects organs, and facilitates movement. It is crucial for development, mineralization, and healing processes, including fracture healing and tissue remodeling.

The RANK/RANKL pathway is crucial for osteoclastogenesis, immune regulation, and T-cell interactions. RANK is a receptor that mediates the function of RANKL, which activates osteoclasts, influencing bone resorption and immune responses.

Denosumab is a monoclonal antibody that inhibits osteoclast formation, function, and survival by binding to RANKL. It is used to treat osteoporosis and other conditions related to excessive bone loss.

relationships.relation: is associated with a dysregulation in the
relationships.interpretation: This relationship suggests a connection between autoimmunity and dysregulation in the Th17 cell pathway

references.title: T cell dysregulation in rheumatoid arthritis: Recent advances and natural product interventions.
references.snippet: Autoimmune diseases result from chronic and dysregulated activation of the immune system, culminating in pathological self-tissue damage, particularly by T and B lymphocytes, which mistakenly target self-antigens.

references.title: Identification of BHLHE40-Expressing CD4 T Cells Producing GM-CSF in Rheumatoid Arthritis.
references.snippet: BHLHE40 expression was found to be higher in Th17 cells than in naive CD4 T cells, suggesting a dysregulated T cell response in autoimmune conditions.

relationships.interpretation: IL-23 modulates the Th17 cell pathway

references.title: The IL-23R and Its Genetic Variants: A Hitherto Unforeseen Bridge Between the Immune System and Cancer Development.
references.snippet: The binding between IL-23R and its specific ligand, the interleukin 23, initiates a number of specific signals by modulating both properties and behavior of immune cells. In particular, it is critical for the regulation of T helper 17 cells (Th17).

references.title: Integrating transcriptomics and network pharmacology to reveal the effect and mechanism of Bai-Jie-Jing-Xie ointment on improving skin inflammation of psoriasis.
references.snippet: BJJX significantly inhibited the levels of inflammatory factors (IL-23, IL-22, IL-17A) and modulated the IL-17 signaling pathway and Th17 cell differentiation.

references.title: Neutrophil exhaustion and impaired functionality in psoriatic arthritis patients.
references.snippet: Serum analyses revealed elevated levels of MMP-9 correlated with increased IL-23, indicating that IL-23 stimulates MMP production in patients.

relationships.relation: are involved in the degradation of

references.title: Matrix metalloproteinase-driven epithelial-mesenchymal transition: implications in health and disease.
references.snippet: Matrix metalloproteinases (MMPs) - a family of zinc-dependent proteases that degrade structural components of the extracellular matrix - sit at the nexus of this transition by dismantling basement membranes.

references.title: Matrix Metalloproteinases in Ureteropelvic Junction Obstruction: Their Role in Pathogenesis and Their Use as Clinical Markers.
references.snippet: Matrix metalloproteinases (MMPs) are a family of zinc-dependent endopeptidases with key roles in extracellular matrix remodeling due to their wide cleavage specificity.

relationships.relation: play a role in the recruitment of

references.title: Interaction with hyaluronan matrix and miRNA cargo as contributors for in vitro potential of mesenchymal stem cell-derived extracellular vesicles in a model of human osteoarthritic synoviocytes.
references.snippet: This work investigated the mechanism of internalization of extracellular vesicles (EVs) released by adipose-derived MSCs and the role of shuttled miRNAs in the restoration of homeostasis in an in vitro model of human fibroblast-like synoviocytes.

references.title: The Role of Cell-Matrix Interactions in Connective Tissue Mechanics.
authors: van Osch, G. J. V. M.
references.snippet: We review recent insights into the biophysical mechanisms involved in the reciprocal interplay between cells and the extracellular matrix, and how this interplay determines tissue mechanics, with implications for fibroblast-like synoviocytes.

relationships.interpretation: FLS contribute to pro-inflammatory cytokines expression

references.title: Mechanical stress overload promotes NF-κB/NLRP3-mediated osteoarthritis synovitis and fibrosis through Piezo1
references.snippet: Under mechanical stress overload, upregulation of Piezo1 can promote the secretion of pro-inflammatory cytokines and the fibrotic process in synovium through the NF-κB/NLRP3 signaling pathway.

references.title: Fibroblast-like synoviocytes and their role in inflammatory joint diseases
references.snippet: Fibroblast-like synoviocytes (FLS) have been identified as crucial mediators in the production of pro-inflammatory cytokines such as IL-6 and TNF-α, contributing significantly to joint inflammation.

relationships.interpretation: Pro-inflammatory cytokines activate signaling pathways that lead to osteoclast differentiation

references.title: ACT001 improves OVX-induced osteoporosis by suppressing the NF-κB/NLRP3 signaling pathway.
references.snippet: ACT001 inhibited RANKL-induced osteoclast differentiation and restrained the phosphorylation of NF-κB, thereby decreasing osteoclastogenesis.

references.title: Osteoimmunology in Osteoarthritis: Unraveling the Interplay of Immunity, Inflammation, and Joint Degeneration.
references.snippet: Immune-mediated mechanisms involving pro-inflammatory cytokines significantly contribute to the progression of osteoarthritis by activating pathways that promote osteoclast differentiation.

relationships.interpretation: Osteoclast differentiation increases resorption of bone tissue

references.title: Echinococcus granulosus promotes MAPK pathway-mediated osteoclast differentiation by inhibiting Nrf2 in osseous echinococcosis.
references.snippet: E. granulosus infection inhibits the expression of Nrf2 in cells, which leads to increased osteoclast differentiation and active bone resorption.

references.title: Duplications within exon 1 of TNFRSF11A encoding receptor activator of nuclear factor-kappa B (RANK) are associated with tendon avulsion.
references.snippet: Different length in-frame duplications within exon 1 of TNFRSF11A increase osteoclast action and cause rapid turnover bone disease.

relationships.interpretation: Bone tissue remodeling is mediated by the RANK/RANKL pathway

references.title: Beyond Bone Remodeling: Denosumab's Multisystemic Benefits in Musculoskeletal Health, Metabolism, and Age-Related Diseases-A Narrative Review.
references.snippet: This review explores the therapeutic effects of denosumab, a RANKL inhibitor, on bone mineral density and its role in the RANK/RANKL/osteoprotegerin pathway.

references.title: Colla Carapacis et Plastri ameliorates postmenopausal osteoporosis and macrophage immunity by modulating the RANK/RANKL/OPG signaling pathway in ovariectomized rats.
references.snippet: This study demonstrated that RANK/RANKL/OPG signaling pathway modulation significantly affects bone microstructure and metabolic outcomes in postmenopausal osteoporosis.

references.title: Moringa oleifera: Exploring the Potential in Managing Bone Loss: Insights from Preclinical Studies.
references.snippet: Moringa oleifera has been shown to promote bone remodeling through its influence on the RANK/RANKL pathway, enhancing osteoclast and osteoblast activities.

relationships.relation: is inhibited by the administration of

references.title: RANK/RANKL Signaling Pathway in Breast Development and Cancer.
references.snippet: RANK signaling is inhibited by denosumab, leading to reduced mammary tumor cell proliferation and enhanced antitumor immune responses.

references.title: Colla Carapacis et Plastri ameliorates postmenopausal osteoporosis and macrophage immunity by modulating the RANK/RANKL/OPG signaling pathway in ovariectomized rats.
references.snippet: The administration of denosumab further enhanced the effects on the RANK/RANKL signaling pathway in ovariectomized rats.

relationships.target: osteoporotic fractures in patients with rheumatoid arthritis
relationships.interpretation: Denosumab reduces the incidence of osteoporotic fractures in patients with rheumatoid arthritis

references.title: Denosumab use reduces risk of rheumatoid arthritis in patients with osteoporosis.
references.snippet: Patients with ever use of denosumab had a reduced risk of osteoporotic fractures (aHR=0.394, 95%CI: 0.192-0.809, p<0.05).

references.title: Denosumab: an effective treatment for reducing the risk of fractures in patients with osteoporosis.
references.snippet: Denosumab has shown promising results in reducing the incidence of osteoporotic fractures in patients suffering from rheumatoid arthritis.

relationships.source: osteoporotic fractures in patients with rheumatoid arthritis
relationships.relation: are characterized by a reduction in
relationships.interpretation: Osteoporotic fractures in patients with rheumatoid arthritis are characterized by a reduction in bone mineral density (BMD)

references.title: Comparison of different intervention thresholds for the treatment of glucocorticoid-induced osteoporosis: a cross-sectional study.
references.snippet: The prevalence of major osteoporotic fractures among rheumatic disease patients, including those with rheumatoid arthritis, reflects a significant reduction in bone mineral density.

references.title: Ultra-Processed Food and Its Impact on Bone Health and Joint Diseases: A Scoping Review.
references.snippet: Higher consumption of ultra-processed foods is associated with lower bone mineral density, increasing the risk of osteoporosis and fractures in individuals with rheumatoid arthritis.

messages.content:
Title: IL-23–MMP Axis as a Driver of Rheumatoid Arthritis-Associated Bone Loss
Statement: We hypothesize that in rheumatoid arthritis, autoimmunity-induced dysregulation of the Th17 cell pathway elevates IL-23 levels, which in turn stimulate matrix metalloproteinase production. The resulting extracellular matrix degradation recruits fibroblast-like synoviocytes that amplify local pro-inflammatory cytokine expression, thereby activating osteoclast differentiation via the RANK/RANKL pathway and reducing bone mineral density. Targeting IL-23 or MMP activity may therefore complement RANKL inhibition (e.g., with Denosumab) to mitigate osteoporotic fractures.
